urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP
@EnvAgency in the permit for walleys Quarry you put tyres on their permitted wastes . I take it you know its illegal to dump tyres except bike tyres up to 1400mm i think https://t.co/p0fgq1UtU4

Surface water, dumping all over instead of concentrated zones & lots of tyres, make this impossible to become a well managed/ organised site. Where is the cover? No wonder why the smell travelled 8 miles last night! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @DefraGovUK #killingus https://t.co/4cKVPgIQov

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Thank you highlighting this environmental catastrophe. We are suffering so much here and it‚Äôs mind boggling how @EnvAgencyMids is allowing it to continue!#stopthestink https://t.co/wNmFhnyIso

urls.title: Legal fund to Stop The Stink, organized by The Landfill Stinks Cap It Off
urls.description: The EA have failed us. Time for a backup plan‚Ä¶ The Landfill Stinks Cap It Off needs your support for Legal fund to Stop The Stink

tweets.text:
Today hundreds of children are breathing in toxic air in Silverdale due to toxic landfill fumes, the environmental agency @EnvAgencyNW is not working quick enough, this is an emergency. Please share and if you can donate https://t.co/kDuVm2eZef
https://t.co/aIHidTSozg

@EnvAgencyMids please donate to the legal fund like the wonderful @LucyABeaumont maybe you @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA  would prefer to donate rather than regulate?It‚Äôs staggering that you‚Äôre  allowing the habitual gassing of a community day after day @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/joatAFexBq

This is what regulatory failure looks like.

Wouldn't that be right @WaterUK, @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, & @EnvAgency? https://t.co/Kixe1VG3NL
Our Windrush neighbour the River Coln is dying and the @EnvAgency just lets it happen. Sound familiar? @Feargal_Sharkey @tomheapmedia https://t.co/j5b4e08b6g

No conflict of interest there then?

https://t.co/DgGZQkXP5K

@DefraUKAir @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA @StinkStopthe unfortunately forecast to to be high as usual in Newcastle Under Lyme thanks to #walleysquarry @redindustries. No chance of us having our windows open for some fresh air @BorisJohnson üò¢ https://t.co/WJjDPWNJo3

So tonight on his jolly jaunt the smell from #WalleysQuarrey has made it 7 miles to Kidsgrove. If this isnt nuisence level what is @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink #stopthestink https://t.co/ranvpF81Jx

@wrurestore @shafm13 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency @NatResWales @fmwales @Amanwy @Eluned_Morgan Simply incorrect. The mains cause is Water Company sewage discharge, some authorised, most, illegal. Period.
